problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: Height of the box
Width of the box
List of items with their dimensions
Length of ITEMS

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Position type)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis
                x_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlapping on y-axis
                y_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)
                # Assert that at least one axis has non-overlap (i.e., no overlap)
                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        assert box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 36, "height": 72}, {"width": 98, "height": 55}, {"width": 66, "height": 53}, {"width": 60, "height": 95}, {"width": 74, "height": 50}, {"width": 84, "height": 13}, {"width": 72, "height": 1}, {"width": 95, "height": 57}, {"width": 74, "height": 53}, {"width": 66, "height": 81}, {"width": 16, "height": 72}, {"width": 91, "height": 82}, {"width": 90, "height": 19}, {"width": 68, "height": 61}, {"width": 83, "height": 80}, {"width": 99, "height": 68}, {"width": 58, "height": 95}, {"width": 88, "height": 4}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 68, "height": 66}]
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        if item_box_assignments[i] > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = item_box_assignments[i]
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width : int = items[i].width
        item_height : int = items[i].height
        pos_x : int = x_y_positions[i].x
        pos_y : int = x_y_positions[i].y
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                # Ensure rectangles do not overlap
                # They overlap if both horizontal and vertical projections overlap
                assert not (
                    (x_y_positions[i].x < x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width) and 
                    (x_y_positions[j].x < x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width) and
                    (x_y_positions[i].y < x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height) and 
                    (x_y_positions[j].y < x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height)
                )

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        # Each item must be assigned to a box within the range of used boxes
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= nr_used_boxes

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

               assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt())):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlap in x-direction
                x_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                                      (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x)
                # Check for non-overlap in y-direction
                y_non_overlap: bool = (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                                      (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):

        # Position coordinates must be non-negative (already constrained by Field definitions)

) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # Either i is to the left of j

                # Or i is below j
                # Or i is above j
                assert (

) -> None:

    # Ensure that the position and box assignment are consistent and valid
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT

                       (other_pos_x + other_item_width <= pos_x) or \

    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        assigned_box: int = assignments[i]

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

        # Ensure no two items in the same box overlap
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            if assignments[j] == assigned_box:
                other_pos_x: int = positions[j].x
                other_pos_y: int = positions[j].y
                other_item_width: int = items[j].width
                other_item_height: int = items[j].height

                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert (pos_x + item_width <= other_pos_x) or \
                       (other_pos_x + other_item_width <= pos_x) or \
                       (pos_y + item_height <= other_pos_y) or \
                       (other_pos_y + other_item_height <= pos_y)

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_non_overlapping_and_box_bounds(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the boundaries of the box
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

        # Compare against all subsequent items
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlapping if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping on x-axis or y-axis
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

ensure_non_overlapping_and_box_bounds(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
